data.title: [2.1] Add 'Godot Contributors' in Project Manager Title
data.body: ![project manager - added godot contributors - godot 2 1 x](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20697655/31004427-892c6a38-a51e-11e7-8314-f7da716e3bf9.png)

data.title: Black textures if no S3TC support is available.  No error messages or warnings.
data.body:
# Versions

**Godot:** 2.1.4 stable (precompiled x86_64 download from site)
**Kernel:** Linux 4.12.13_1 #1 SMP PREEMPT Thu Sep 14 13:15:00 UTC 2017 x86_64 GNU/Linux
**GPU:** AMD Barts PRO [Radeon HD 6850], from circa 2011
**Graphics drivers:** In-kernel "radeon" (standard mesa, X11, etc stack)
**Distro:** Void Linux 

# Issue description
Without the S3TC (libtxc_dxtn) library for Mesa installed: all/most textures appear solid black.  No errors, warnings or explanations are provided.

Truck town:
![screenshot](https://i.imgur.com/UOGZ3jG.png)
![screenshot](https://i.imgur.com/EvG4z7Z.png)

Installing this library fixes the problem.  

# Expected behaviours

(1) Godot does not try to use compressed textures when support for them is not available.
(2) Errors or warnings are given to the user in either/both cases.

data.title: Vector2.reflect() result is unexpected
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
3.0master build 0dbec3a

When reflecting a vector by a normal, for example to bounce off a surface, the resulting vector isn't reflected as expected (it's reversed):
```
var v1 = Vector2(100, 100)
var n = Vector2(0, -1)
var v2 = v1.reflect(n)
```
Expected result: `(100, -100)`
Actual result: `(-100, 100)`

As a workaround, I've been using `-v1.reflect(n)`

data.title: Schlick-GGX F0 value is hardcoded to 1
data.body: I believe this was read from a texture a some point. The current value is quite off for dielectrics.

data.title: Globals.set("display/stretch_aspect", "keep") doesn't change the aspect to keep at all
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Linux 4.10.0-35-generic on Elementary Os 0.4.1 (based on Ubuntu 16.04)

VGA compatible controller: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. [AMD/ATI] Tonga PRO [Radeon R9 285/380] (rev f1)
server glx version string: 1.4
client glx version string: 1.4
GLX version: 1.4
    Max core profile version: 4.5
    Max compat profile version: 3.0
    Max GLES1 profile version: 1.1
    Max GLES[23] profile version: 3.1
OpenGL core profile version string: 4.5 (Core Profile) Mesa 17.2.1 - padoka PPA
OpenGL core profile shading language version string: 4.50
OpenGL version string: 3.0 Mesa 17.2.1 - padoka PPA
OpenGL shading language version string: 1.30
OpenGL ES profile version string: OpenGL ES 3.1 Mesa 17.2.1 - padoka PPA
OpenGL ES profile shading language version string: OpenGL ES GLSL ES 3.10


**Issue description:**
Nothing happened, the stretch aspect isn't keep after executing this function. I was planing to change the stretch aspect if the window's aspect ratio was lower than 4:3 just for unexpected cases


**Steps to reproduce:**
```
#set an stretch aspect other than keep at the project properties
func _ready():
	print(Globals.get("display/stretch_aspect"))
	Globals.set("display/stretch_aspect", "keep")
	print(Globals.get("display/stretch_aspect"))
```

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Connected signals will be disconnected if the target node changes its type
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3.0 master https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/4f39ce32b9195405f934445b20059e86632b47f9

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
When changing the type of a node all connected signals to that node will be disconnected.
![https://i.imgur.com/s0h1LVZ.gifv](https://i.imgur.com/s0h1LVZ.gif)


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create two nodes
2. Connect a signal from one to another
3. Change the type of the target node

data.title: Fix Oren-Nayar diffuse.
data.body:
I found the [source](http://mimosa-pudica.net/improved-oren-nayar.html) for the current approximation  and I fixed the inconsistencies.

I can't say that approximation is that good though because *relative* errors are pretty high (he only shows absolute errors which makes it look at lot better that it actually is), I can submit another PR for an exact implementation without neglecting any terms at all (although that could be a bit slower).

data.title: Control previous rectangle doesn't show or is mirrored while resizing
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3.0 master https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/4f39ce32b9195405f934445b20059e86632b47f9

<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
![https://i.imgur.com/U4baGlF.gifv](https://i.imgur.com/U4baGlF.gif)

It doesn't show if the affected properties are the margin right/bottom.
It's get drawn mirrored (and updates each change) if the affected properties are the margin top/left.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Add a control
2. Resize

data.title: 3.0 Editor not opening when placed inside project folder
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 7 sp1, geforce gtx750, 6gb ram, Godot_v3.0-alpha1_win64

**Issue description:**
Godot newbie here. I just found out that, when the main Godot executable is placed in a project's folder, upon launching it, only a 3d view (+the console in background) of the main scene is shown, without the rest of the editor.

(https://i.imgur.com/4nf39sd.jpg)
![4nf39sd](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8281454/30987484-1a1f59bc-a4d2-11e7-9fe8-ceca540fbc1a.jpg)


**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a project, add 3d content, save a scene with a camera, close Godot. Via OS file explorer place the Godot executable (3.0 alpha1, 64bit) inside the project's folder and run it.

data.title: Exported variables don't get saved until they are modified
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3.0 master https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/4f39ce32b9195405f934445b20059e86632b47f9

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
I have this script that exports a bool to the inspector.:
```
tool
extends ParallaxLayer

export (bool) var centered = false setget set_centered, get_centered

var _centered = false

func set_centered(v):
	if v == null:
		print("Somehow the value is null")
	_centered = v
	if Engine.is_editor_hint() && has_node("sprite"):
		$sprite.centered = _centered
func get_centered():
	return _centered
	
func _ready():
		
	print("new layer")
	print(centered)
	print(_centered)
	
	$sprite.centered = _centered
```
When I add an instance of the scene the checkbox in the inspector is unchecked and also shows the button to go back to the default value which shouldn't do it because I haven't modified the value:
![https://i.imgur.com/57Qf1zO.png](https://i.imgur.com/57Qf1zO.png)

Because I haven't modified the value it won't get saved to the `*.tscn`:
```
...
[ext_resource path="res://unlimited_parallax_layer.tscn" type="PackedScene" id=2]
[ext_resource path="res://sprites/bg1.png" type="Texture" id=3]
...
[node name="layer4" parent="bg" instance=ExtResource( 2 )]

texture = ExtResource( 3 )
...
```

Which, when running the game, creates the following issue:
Output:
```
Somehow the value is null
new layer
False
Null
```

And the debugger stops with `Invalid set index 'centered' (on base: 'Sprite')` and points to the last line `$sprite.centered = _centered`

If I check and uncheck the checkbox in the inspector the value will be saved to t he `*.tscn` and the problem will go away. The return to default icon will also be gone.

I'm not sure if this is a generic issue or a boolean only one because I haven't tested it with other types.

data.title: Relationship between Oren-Nayar σ and Burley roughness
data.body:
Is the current Oren-Nayar implementation a particular approximation valid for certain range of parameters? I found it deviates a lot from the original [Oren-Nayar](http://www1.cs.columbia.edu/CAVE/publications/pdfs/Oren_SIGGRAPH94.pdf), when for example the diffuse gets small partially due to the color-independent contribution to A.

Also it might be nice to add a note somewhere (in godot-docs maybe?) that roughness in Oren-Nayar is a standard deviation which can exceed 1 whereas it should be between 0 and 1 for Burley.

data.title: Added descriptions for all Particles2D.xml methods
data.body: I rewrote my contribution to follow the guidelines and the suggestions made in the former PR.

data.title: Editor: Run validation on every text change, not only inserts
data.body:
Fixes #11616 by running validation on every code change in the editor, not only on inserts.

Tested locally, seems to work fine - not sure if there was any reason to only do this on inserts though :)

data.title: add spacing to tabs.
data.body: Sadly I Couldn't get my additional spacing default through. But I'm happy with having bigger tabs since this was the biggest concern I had anyways. So this pr is now updating the tab size only. (and fixes use of `EDITOR_DEF` (in one case) and updated to `EDITOR_GET`) this is how it looks: how it looked before can still be seen in the deprecated section... ## DEPRECATED! old default: new default:

data.title: Renamed fixed_process to physics_process
data.body: The method "_fixed_process" does not describe correctly its behaviour. It's executed right before each physics step so this name "_physics_process" is more accurate.

data.title: Reintroduce generic mobile vr interface
data.body:
I've only tested this on iPhone, in theory it should work on Android as well. I've also not had any time to polish things up any further. Also right now it gets included on all platforms, I'll change the detect.py file soon to just compile on mobile devices.

There are loads of enhancements possible, definitely room for some more auto detection to setup sensible default values for the hardware you're on.

In essence this is a pretty basic cardboard-esk implementation for mobile VR including using the gyro and accelerometer data for head orientation. It is very similar to my pure GDScript navmesh implementation but now purely done as an ARVR interface.

![img_6542](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1945449/30966455-4328fdc6-a49c-11e7-97b5-859206b68bf1.PNG)

As always you can use this sample project to test this PR:
https://github.com/BastiaanOlij/godot3_test_projects/tree/master/TestGodotARVR

I'll probably do a video soon to detail things out a little bit

data.title: 3D editor enhancements and fixes
data.body:
Hi everyone, (yes I'm copying groud :D)

I plan to work on the 3D editor to make it ready for real work and fix bugs. I opened this issue to discuss what and how the changes should be implemented.

Here is list of what could be added:

**Enhancements:**
- [x] Add Scale Gizmo support - PR #11478 
- [ ] Expose Global/Local Space mode to toolbar as an icon and with default shortcut
- [ ] Selected object Outline with faded solid and line visualization for intersecting geometry - WIP
- [ ] World space Grid snapping support
- [ ] Lock object for 3D #4447
- [ ] GridMap - Include transforms of tile object's children when generating .meshlib file #11722
- [ ] Display details like shapes and icons of instanced scenes #8261

**Fixes:**
- [x] Rotate Gizmo going crazy - PR #11842
- [ ] Support for Planar Translate in Local Space
- [ ] Grid Map node editing broken when node is rotated #2668
- [ ] AABB style Gizmos are broken when Spatial that uses them are scaled - @kubecz3k make an Issue plz :)

**Candidates:**
Selectable Children toggle for 3D #11756

**Temp:**
#10453
#8746
#4448 ???
#2620 ?

data.title: Allow using wildcards to filter docstatus class names
data.body:
Just something I needed while documenting VisualScript classes. It allows doing:
```bash
$ python doc/tools/doc_status.py doc/classes VisualScript\*
```

data.title: [DOCS] Document some of the VisualScript classes

Also, fixed a bug with VisualScriptCustomNode disconnecting all of its ports when the script changes.

data.title: transform.x, transform.basis_xform are wrong when parented
data.body:
Godot version 3.0 alpha

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
If a parent object is rotated so it looks straight upwards, and you are parented to this object so you look straight upwards (but have local rotation zeroed out), transform.x and so on returns a value as if the parent had not rotated you.
So transform.x returns Vector2(1,0), even though the 'right' local axis points in another direction visually.
Expectation: transform.x is local2world Vector2(1,0), and transform.basis_xform(..) is local2world any vector.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Root: Node
Object1: Node2D     <--- give some rotation
    child: Object2: Node2D       <--- give some other rotation
         child: Object3: Node2D <-- attach script.

func _process(delta):
    global_position += transform.x

Also try:
   global_position += get_node("../").transform.x

This is also an issue for instance when shooting a bullet from a rotated gun, that gets parented to the root and gets the local2world right vector from the gun as the direction to travel.
See attached test_scene2 for an example.
[Local transforms issue 3.0.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1340183/Local.transforms.issue.3.0.zip)


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
